The widget queue handles the deferred computation of certain widget properties. It is used e.g. for the tree to update the indentation of tree nodes.

This queue calls the method {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#syncWidget} of each queued widget before the layout queues are processed.
This contains a map of widgets hash ($hash) and their corresponding map of jobs.
This contains all the queued widgets for the next flush.
Job identifier. If not used, it will be converted to ”$default”.

Adds a widget to the queue. The second param can be used to identify several jobs. You can add one job at once, which will be returned as an map at flushing on method {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#syncWidget}.

Flushes the widget queue.

This is used exclusively by the {@link qx.ui.core.queue.Manager}.
Job identifier. If not used, it will be converted to ”$default”.

Clears given job of a widget from the internal queue. If no jobs left, the widget will be removed completely from queue. If job param is null or undefined widget will be removed completely from queue. Normally only used during interims disposes of one or a few widgets.
